dataset.title: Winter Marine Surveys of the Northern Antarctic Peninsula, 2012-2016

creator.positionName: Program Lead, Krill and Oceanographic Research

abstract.para: Winter survey data from the Northern Antarctic Peninsula (including hydrography, zooplankton, and top predators) conducted from the R/V Nathaniel B. Palmer during the austral winter (August-September) of 2012-2016. Survey stations were selected from the U.S. Antarctic Marine Living Resources Program's standard grid, approximately 15-20 nm apart covering the region 60° to 64° S and 54° to 63° W. At each station, hydrography and chlorophyll measurements were collected with CTD profilers and Niskin bottles, and macrozooplankton samples were collected using an Isaacs-Kidd Midwater Trawl. Between stations, observers recorded abundance and behavior of top predators (seabirds and marine mammals).

intellectualRights.para: This data package is released to the "public domain" under Creative Commons CC0 1.0 "No Rights Reserved" (see: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/). It is considered professional etiquette to provide attribution of the original work if this data package is shared in whole or by individual components. A generic citation is provided for this data package on the website https://portal.edirepository.org (herein "website") in the summary metadata page. Communication (and collaboration) with the creators of this data package is recommended to prevent duplicate research or publication. This data package (and its components) is made available "as is" and with no warranty of accuracy or fitness for use. The creators of this data package and the website shall not be liable for any damages resulting from misinterpretation or misuse of the data package or its components. Periodic updates of this data package may be available from the website. Thank you.

contact.positionName: Program Lead, Krill and Oceanographic Research

dataTable.entityDescription: Data collected at sampling stations, including zooplankton abundance and physical and biological oceanography.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Station identifier by year, season, and US Antarctic Marine Living Resources (AMLR) grid location. E.g., AMLR2016_W0013 corresponds to the station at location 13, surveyed in winter (W) of 2016.
Cruise identifier. "AMLR" followed by the year e.g., "AMLR2016".
Full station identifier. Season ("W" for winter) followed by the AMLR grid identifier.
Location of station in the AMLR grid.
Cruise leg. In this dataset, always "W" for winter.
Area within the AMLR grid, which is divided into four sectors.

codeDefinition.definition: Elephant Island sector, corresponding to the northeast portion of the grid.
Joinville Island sector, corresponding to the southeast part of the grid.
South Area sector, corresponding to the area of the grid within the Bransfield Strait.
West Area sector, corresponding to the area northwest of the South Shetland Islands.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Groups of small-scale management units (GSSMUs) defined by CCAMLR.
Which time net went into the water at station (1 for first, 2 for second)
Predominate ice type when net was fishing; combination of ice type and % ice cover

Upper mixed layer depth. The upper mixed layer depth was calculated as the depth (m) where the potential density differed by 0.05 kg m− 3 from the average of the potential density over the 5–10 m depth.
Potential density difference averaged over the upper mixed layer
Average of salinity in the upper mixed layer.
Average of water temperature in the upper mixed layer.
Chl a concentration at upper mixed layer depth, as measured by Niskin bottle samples
Phaeopigment concentration at upper mixed layer depth, as measured by Niskin bottle samples
Chl a concentration at 100 m, as measured by Niskin bottle samples
Phaeopigment concentration at 100 m, as measured by Niskin bottle samples
Chl a concentration at upper mixed layer depth, estimated by regressing CTD fluorescence data
Chl a concentration from Niskin bottle at 100 m, estimated by regressing CTD fluorescence data
Phaeopigment concentration at upper mixed layer depth, estimated by regressing CTD fluorescence data
Phaeopigment concentration at 100 m, estimated by regressing CTD fluorescence data
Was ice present at time of observation (usually as net started up from depth)?
Percent ice cover at time of net trawl.

codeDefinition.definition: Some ice present (only used 2012 before protocol standardized)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Station macrozooplankton cluster assignment from Dietrich et al. (2021)

codeDefinition.definition: Macrozooplankton cluster 1 (defined in Dietrich et al. 2021)
Macrozooplankton cluster 2a (defined in Dietrich et al. 2021)
Macrozooplankton cluster 2b (defined in Dietrich et al. 2021)
Macrozooplankton cluster 3a (defined in Dietrich et al. 2021)
Macrozooplankton cluster 3b (defined in Dietrich et al. 2021)

attribute.attributeDefinition: First NMDS axis value of macrozooplankton community analysis from Dietrich et al. (2021) Progress in Oceanography doi:10.1016/j.pocean.2021.102610
Second NMDS axis value of macrozooplankton community analysis from Dietrich et al. (2021) Progress in Oceanography doi:10.1016/j.pocean.2021.102610
Third NMDS axis value of macrozooplankton community analysis from Dietrich et al. (2021) Progress in Oceanography doi:10.1016/j.pocean.2021.102610
Abundance - # per m3 - Fish eggs unid
Abundance - # per m3 - Euphausia superba (larvae-furcilia stage)

dataTable.entityDescription: Ice conditions along the survey trackline. Each row corresponds to a ~1 nmi survey interval (see PredatorSightings).

codeDefinition.definition: Mix of first and multi-year ice
Mix of first year and slushy ice
Mix of first year and thin ice
Mix of multi-year and first year ice
Mix of slush and first year ice
Mix of slush and thin ice
Mix of thin and first year ice
Mix of thin ice and slush

dataTable.entityDescription: Sightings of predators (marine mammals and seabirds) along vessel trackline.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Interval identifier within a process. Each interval aggregates all predator sightings of a species within 1 nautical mile.
Length of interval in nautical miles.
Julian day at start of interval
Julian day at end of interval
Date and time at start of interval
Date and time at end of interval
Average sea surface temperature (measured by ship's instruments)

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: Ship's instrument reading not recorded during interval
Ship's instrument reading not recorded during interval

attribute.attributeDefinition: Average air temperature (measured by ship's instruments)

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: Ship's instrument reading not recorded during interval
Ship's instrument reading not recorded during interval
Ship's instrument reading not recorded during interval

attribute.attributeDefinition: Average wind speed (measured by ship's instruments)

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: Ship's instrument reading not recorded during interval

attribute.attributeDefinition: Average wind directino (measured by ship's instruments)

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: Ship's instrument reading not recorded during interval

codeDefinition.definition: Poor; 300m strip box is difficult to see and heavy fog is likely
Moderate; can only see the 300m strip box, likely foggy or squall type weather
Good; can see the 300m strip box with no problem and beyond up to 3km
Optimal; horizon is not present but can see greater than 3km (common)
Best; can see a sharp horizon over 5km

attribute.attributeDefinition: AMLR station id, when at a station
